subject: p19389547
Findings: In comparison with the study of, there is increased prominence of opacification adjacent to the right lateral chest wall. It is unclear whether this could merely reflect change in degree of obliquity of the patient or whether there is a reason to suggest increased fluid within the pleural space. The right hemidiaphragm remains sharp and there is nothing to indicate layering pleural effusion. This information has been telephoned to Dr. , was covering for Dr.
